title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco and Brandon Baez sentenced to federal prison for mail theft and check fraud in Massachusetts.
Rios-Franco received 35 months in prison and must pay $12,528 restitution, while Baez got two years and must pay $10,285.
The scheme involved stealing checks from USPS boxes, altering them, and depositing into controlled bank accounts from June 2023 to Feb 2024.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Milford teen Marcelo Gomes da Silva, detained by ICE in 2025, invited to State of the Union by Rep. Seth Moulton.
Gomes was detained in May 2025 while driving, in an ICE operation targeting his father, a Brazilian immigrant.
Gomes' release on bond followed community protests; he described 'humiliating' conditions at the detention facility.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal in Team USA's Olympic win over Denmark, describing it humorously afterward.
Despite Swayman's mishap, the U.S. secured a win with strong offensive performance while he made 18 saves.
Swayman joked about speculation on visibility issues due to rink colors, stating, 'I'm colorblind, so it doesn't matter to me.'

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum may soon return from an Achilles injury, impacting the Boston Celtics' playoff prospects.
Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony discuss Tatum's anticipated comeback at NBA All-Star weekend.
Tatum has been practicing, including with Celtics' G League team, hinting at a nearing return.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space this offseason for potential free agency acquisitions.
Colts WR Alec Pierce, known for his big-play ability, is a free agent target for the Patriots.
Packers OT Rasheed Walker is a top free agent option for Patriots' offensive line improvements.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN has partnered with MLB.TV, making it the new streaming platform for Major League Baseball games.
ESPN Unlimited subscribers can add MLB.TV for $134.99, while non-subscribers can access it for $149.99.
Existing MLB.TV subscribers will renew through their current accounts, with an optional ESPN Unlimited free trial.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics' Ron Harper Jr. praised Jayson Tatum's performance during a G League practice with the Maine Celtics.
Tatum is rehabilitating from an Achilles tear but has not confirmed a return date for this season.
Celtics' Brad Stevens emphasizes Tatum's return depends on him being '110 percent' ready.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in WalletHub's 2026 analysis, excelling in higher education attainment and public school performance.
Over 47% of adults in Massachusetts hold a bachelor's degree, and nearly 22% have a graduate or professional degree.
Vermont and Maryland followed Massachusetts in educational rankings, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia were last.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: The T206 Honus Wagner baseball card, featured in Netflix's "King of Collectibles," is up for auction until February 21.
The card, initially obtained in the early 1900s, has been kept in the same family for 116 years.
The current auction bid for the card stands at $3.9 million, with a potential sale price of $4,758,000 including fees.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman, 27, will start in goal for Team USA against Denmark at the 2026 Winter Olympics.
Swayman has been a consistent figure on Team USA's roster, achieving a 5-0 record in the 2025 IIHF World Championship.
Connor Hellebuyck, 2025 Vezina Trophy winner, will serve as backup goalie for the game against Denmark.
